title: Fed’s George Said Her FOMC Dissent Was Tied To Concern Over Size of Rate Rise
sub_head: Federal Reserve Bank of Kansas City president says large, unexpected changes in rate policy can unsettle economy
body:
Federal Reserve Bank of Kansas City President Esther George said Friday that she voted against the central bank’s supersize rate rise this week because unexpected and large moves in monetary policy can unsettle households and businesses.
“With high inflation and a tight economy, the case for continuing to remove policy accommodation is clear-cut,” Ms. George said in a statement. “However, the speed with which we adjust the policy rate is important,” she said.
